TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented Mr Y. Zaytsev , their Agent , and PERSON NORP , Head of ORG before ORG .

Prior to DATE the applicant had been certified as falling within the “ second category of invalidity ” ( друга група інвалідності ) on account of a haematological disease . He was receiving a disability pension and earning occasional additional income collecting and selling wild produce .

In DATE the applicant sustained an injury ( concussion and bone fractures ) in a car accident caused by Mr PERSON , an employee of the Auto - transport unit of ORG ( “ the ORG ” ; ORG міського управління охорони здоров’я ) , who was subsequently sentenced for dangerous driving .

In the aftermath of the accident , the applicant was certified as falling within the “ first category of invalidity ” on account of the injury . However , in DATE a medical commission restored him into the “ second category ” , having found that the remaining effects of the injury could not justify the attribution of the “ first category ” . The applicant , however , ceased collecting wild produce allegedly due to deterioration of his health condition .
In DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings against the ORG seeking compensation for his medical expenses and the loss of earnings .
On DATE the ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ; GPE районний суд м. ORG ) allowed the applicant ’s claims in part . On DATE ORG ( Кримський обласний суд ) upheld this judgment and it became final .

In DATE , pursuant the introduction of the new cassation procedure , the applicant lodged a cassation appeal against the above rulings , seeking higher payments . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal in cassation .

In DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings against the ORG seeking additional compensations . On DATE ORG rejected this claim as unsubstantiated . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment and it became final .

On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings seeking to obtain additional compensation for the loss of earnings , medical and rehabilitation expenses and other payments from the ORG . In the course of the proceedings , the applicant amended his claims on CARDINAL occasions .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims , finding that the applicant ’s health condition was not connected to the accident and his disability category was not affected by the injury sustained .
On DATE ORG PERSON ) upheld this judgment and it became final .

On DATE ORG of the LOC quashed the above rulings following a protest ( an extraordinary appeal ) introduced by its Acting President and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . In particular , the court found that additional investigation was necessary into the specific health damage caused by the accident .

In the course of subsequent proceedings , the courts ordered the total of CARDINAL independent medical expert opinions , some of which contradicted the others , and interviewed CARDINAL specialists involved in the applicant ’s treatment .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims , finding , based on a medical assessment , that the accident had certain lasting effects on the applicant ’s health , but they required no special treatment and were not linked to the damage claimed .
On DATE ORG of the GPE quashed this decision and remitted the case for fresh examination . Subsequently , the court assumed first instance jurisdiction over the case .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims . It found that part of them had been finally adjudicated in other proceedings brought in DATE and DATE ( see sections B and C above ) . As regards the other claims , the court found no causal link between the effects of the accident on the applicant ’s health and the expenses claimed . It further dismissed the claim for loss of earnings as unsubstantiated , since the applicant had subsisted on disability pension , while his produce collecting activities could not be regarded as “ earnings ” .

On DATE ORG of GPE quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . It instructed the trial court to assess the degree of work fitness lost by the applicant as a result of the accident , without regard to his prior disability , and to make an additional investigation into the importance of the produce collection as a source of the applicant ’s income .

On DATE ORG , relying on a new medical expert opinion , decided that the injury resulting from the accident was sufficient to entitle the applicant to a “ third category invalidity ” ( третя группа інвалідності ) and that the applicant ’s produce collecting activities could qualify as “ lost earnings ” . Therefore , the court awarded the applicant CARDINAL hryvnyas in compensation . The applicant appealed , considering this sum insufficient .

On DATE ORG of GPE quashed this judgment and remitted the case for a fresh consideration , referring to several contradictions in the opinions of medical experts as to the applicant ’s loss of work fitness and challenging the method of calculating the award .
On DATE ORG ( formerly ORG ) rejected the applicant ’s claims as unsubstantiated . The applicant appealed in cassation .

On DATE the court suspended the applicant ’s cassation appeal and proposed that he rectify its formal shortcomings . On DATE the court returned the appeal as “ not lodged ” on account of the applicant ’s failure to rectify the above shortcomings . The applicant did not challenge this decision .
Subsequently the applicant unsuccessfully attempted to re - lodge his appeal in cassation after the expiry of the statutory time - limit .
